thread.title: Marquis Who's Who Honors Brian D. Babcock for Expertise in Consulting
thread.title_full: Marquis Who's Who Honors Brian D. Babcock for Expertise in Consulting

title: Marquis Who's Who Honors Brian D. Babcock for Expertise in Consulting
text:
June 12, 2025
COLUMBIA, TN, June 12, 2025 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Brian D. Babcock has been selected for inclusion in Marquis Who's Who. As in all Marquis Who's Who biographical volumes, individuals profiled are selected on the basis of current reference value. Factors such as position, noteworthy accomplishments, visibility, and prominence in a field are all taken into account during the selection process.
Mr. Babcock is a distinguished expert in consulting, materials and intellectual property, as well as technology development for commercialization. As the president and founder of PCCT Consulting in Nashville, Tennessee, since 2019, he has been instrumental in providing fractional intellectual property management consulting to numerous startups. His role involves advising clients on managing their technology, assisting with initial patent filings, and developing intellectual property strategies as products are brought to market. Additionally, Mr. Babcock supports the technical aspects of innovation plans and engages in expert witness and litigation consulting, reviewing cases provided by the attorney and preparing various aspects of reports.
Before founding PCCT Consulting, Mr. Babcock was an intellectual property manager at SunEdison/GCL Solar Materials between 2015 and 2018. Before his tenure at SunEdison/GCL Solar Materials, he held dual roles as a principal scientist and intellectual property director at Surnetics from 2013 to 2015. During this period, Mr. Babcock developed significant intellectual property and technology for coating diagnostics and managing liquid control in diagnostics, building a comprehensive portfolio that opened numerous opportunities for him.
From 2013 to 2015, Mr. Babcock also worked as a patent agent at Pauly, DeVries, Smith & Deffner LLC, where he honed his skills in patent law and further expanded his expertise in intellectual property management services for small and large companies. His career at Donaldson began in 2004 as a senior chemical engineer before transitioning to intellectual property manager from 2008 to 2013. Earlier in his career, Mr. Babcock gained valuable experience as a chemical engineer at Kimberly-Clark, starting in 2001.
Mr. Babcock's academic background includes a Bachelor of Science and Master of Science in chemical engineering from Vanderbilt University. He also holds credentials as a certified licensing professional from Certified Licensing Professional Inc. and a U.S. patent agent from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.
Beyond his professional endeavors, Mr. Babcock is actively involved with civic-minded organizations, such as Scouting America, where he volunteers. Headquartered in Texas, the nonprofit is recognized as the largest scouting organization and one of the largest youth organizations in the nation.
Looking ahead, Mr. Babcock aims to continue leading his consulting company and providing expert advice. He also plans to remain dedicated to guiding younger generations through the challenges of modern work environments, helping them adapt and succeed in their careers while identifying clear paths forward.
About Marquis Who's Who®:
Since 1899, when A. N. Marquis printed the First Edition of Who's Who in America®, Marquis Who's Who® has chronicled the lives of the most accomplished individuals and innovators from every significant field of endeavor, including politics, business, medicine, law, education, art, religion and entertainment. Who's Who in America® remains an essential biographical source for thousands of researchers, journalists, librarians and executive search firms around the world. The suite of Marquis® publications can be viewed at the official Marquis Who's Who® website, www.marquiswhoswho.com.
